resources.string: The Fens are a wretched place. \n\nThough we strive to bring light where we can, this is one territory that may not be worth the effort.
Hm. Do you have a delivery for me? \n\nNo? Then spare me your presence, I have no patience for it.
Hoped I might bump into you out here. \n\nBeen searching this miserable swamp with nary a friend nor a bit of treasure to sustain me.
This land cries out in pain. \n\nIf you cannot hear it, it's because you have made yourself deaf to its cries.
Have you found the meaning behind your vision? \n\nThese things can take time to figure out.
Hope you didn’t come here, wanting a meal. It’s a dreadful stinking bog that resists every effort to make decent farmland. \n\nEat the plants from these fields and you’ll be in the privvy for a week.
The Weavers of the Fen make the finest garments in all Aeternum. \n\n If you see something you like in the marketplace, it was probably crafted by us.
Whatever brought you to the Fen, I'm confident it probably isn't a pleasant thing. \n\nDon't believe everyone's tales of woe, however. There is a way to live here and be happy.
The Crone's Curse
Find any information pertaining to the whereabouts of the Corpse Crone.
Search Periville for any information on the Corpse Crone
Study the Corpse Crone's plants
Follow the trail of the Corpse Crone's victims
Search for information on the Corpse Crone
Search for more journal pages from the Corpse Crone
Bring the Corpse Crone's journal back to Galahad
Look at the Wanted Poster for the Corpse Crone

We've come this far, and discovering the truth about the source of the Lost plague seems wise. \n\nBut there's a great deal of ground to cover, and little time, if the Corrupted are as strong as they seem.
"The Corpse Crone is the next clue."

Careful not to give too much credit to the Azoth Tree - nature here does not always align with humanity's best interests. \n\nIf she exists, I suspect, however, the Corpse Crone may be hiding secrets of significant power.
"Where do we find the Crone?"

There's a stalwart knight named Ser Brytmar who once protected the Fen - if she remains, I shall request her aid in this venture. \n\nMeanwhile, the Crone's curse began in Periville so I suggest you search there. Do be careful.
Light be with you in Periville. \n\nI'll meet you outside of Karburg later.

The flowers referenced in the Ancient tablets quickly proved a waste of time. Whatever reason the Ancients cultivated them, it was not to defend against the Crimson Madness. 

Conversely, the mushrooms seem to offer some promise. I was able to infuse them with the azoth from the ruins, and the mushrooms' luminescence dims when in the presence of Corruption. 

Desperate as they are, it was not difficult to convince the villagers here to drink the mushroom concoction I prepared, though I did leave out the fact that they were gathered from the ruins. Whether the serum is effective remains to be seen.

Finally, my efforts have yielded results. I have exposed several volunteers to Corruption and while the mixture may still require some fine-tuning, it's clear that it works... with some caveats. 

Unfortunately, I noticed right away that the cure somehow "deadened" the volunteers' senses, and a short time later, they seemed to lose their ability to communicate. Later, their eyes began to glow with a chilling azoth blue, and they eventually became completely non-responsive. The villagers have taken to calling them "Lost," and the condition seems to be irreversible. 

I am convinced that with a few more tests, I can eliminate these disappointing side effects, but of course, I am now having great difficulty recruiting more volunteers. Even Brytmar is having doubts.

Damn it all, the situation here in Periville is deteriorating by the hour! It seems one of the "Lost" somehow passed their condition on to a family member who had not been a volunteer. I offered to assess and treat the poor woman, but I was met with nothing but anger and fury. 

Everyone seems to have forgotten that this effort is in pursuit of protection against a far greater evil! With a few further tests... I am certain I can perfect the cure, and perhaps even find a remedy. If I am to find more volunteers, however, it will not be here. 

Brytmar is helping to pack up all my equipment and research, and we will leave this town of fools in the morning. Good riddance.

Let it be hereby known that the Shadow Hunters of Karburg are offering a reward for anyone providing information that leads to the capture of the Corpse Crone. 

The foul sorceress has dark hair and a pale, violet scar in place of a missing eye. She was last seen fleeing her home in Periville, but it is believed that she remains in hiding somewhere in Weaver's Fen. 

Let it be further known that anyone who harbors or abets the Crone shall be held to equal account for her crimes and shall be subject to the same sentence.

I hope you had better luck than I, my friend. The legacy of the Corpse Crone seems to have claimed every town in this region. \n\nThe only thing I've learned about Ser Brytmar is that she departed from this area in some haste.
"The Crone mentions Brytmar in her journal."

You found the Crone's grimoire? Quite an important clue! Filled with records of her vile conjurations, no doubt. \n\nBut if it makes mention of Brytmar, then I should very much like to study it further.
The Curse of Karburg
Discover what the Corpse Crone did to Karburg.
Travel to Karburg to find the Corpse Crone
Discover Karburg's tragic past
Remove the Corpse Crone's hexes
Search for the source of the curse
Defeat cursed Karburg Impaler
Defeat cursed Karburg Revenant

Though the Bright Vigil never came this far east, it seems there were those who sought to hold the Crone accountable for her crimes. \n\nI presume you saw the posters? These shadow hunters gathered in Karburg.
"Yes, we should search there next."

Perhaps. I've just come from searching Brytmar's home there. The Crone's curse swept through Karburg like a hurricane. \n\nIt appears the entire town fell Lost in hours, and the curse still haunts the streets like a contagion.
"I can go alone."

Very well. I should spend time studying this journal for clues to the Crone's fate and that of the brave and loyal Brytmar. \n\nLearn what you can in Karburg and then meet me on the town's outskirts. Light be with you, warden.
If there are clues to Brytmar's fate in this journal, I will find them.
I heard you were looking for me.
Yes. We won’t allow you to profane this place with your foul sorcery, witch!
Enough! I don't have time for your ignorance!
[Screams]
See what horrors transpired here? Corruption is truly the least of the evils this island has to offer.
Hmmph! This journal tells more lies than truths! I simply cannot believe Brytmar would support this foul sorcery! \n\nWhat did you learn in Karburg? Did the Hunters manage to apprehend the Crone?
"No. She cursed the town to escape."
She cursed an entire town? Such power rivals the magic of even Myrddin himself! \n\nPerhaps that explains Brytmar as well… yes, surely the Crone had ensorcelled my brave friend. That must be it.
Bridge Into the Past
Follow the Corpse Crone's studies on the Vega Bridge.
Find a way onto the bridge
Follow the trail of will-o'-the-wisps
Climb up Vega Bridge
Continue to climb up Vega Bridge
Talk to Grace O'Malley about the bridge
Read another journal page of the Corpse Crone
Find a way to open the Ancient Chest
Open the Ancient Chest
Discover who looted the chest
Talk to Grace O'Malley about the empty chest
Meet with Galahad in Twillen
(Optional: Check in at the Inn in Twillen)

The only place that hasn't fallen Lost in this dreadful swamp is the ramshackle settlement of Twillen. \n\nI should like to go there and inquire after Brytmar. I cannot rest until I find an explanation for all this.
"What about the Crone herself?"

If the journal is to be believed, the Crone spent centuries studying the Ancient ruins in the Fen. \n\nThat is undoubtedly where she acquired her power. The last entry makes specific mention of the ruins at Vega Bridge.
"Then I'll search for clues there."

That makes sense. I hope you find answers. I hope we learn the Crone ultimately faced justice for what she did. \n\nI will go on to Twillen and inquire about both Brytmar and the Crone - I'll await you there.
I refuse to believe Brytmar capable of conspiring with such evil.

Well now, your timing's as fickle as the tides! It sure would've been nice if you had shown up before I spent six hours trying this myself. \n\nThis chest is locked by some puzzle, and that's really more your thing than mine.
"What are you doing here?"

After you left Caer Dun, that alchemist suggested you might need help, tracking down the Crone and all. \n\nOf course, she also mentioned treasure in these ruins... and here we are, a bit of both if we can get this chest open.
"The Crone was researching here."
Did she? Well then, I'm willing to bet she was after whatever's in this chest. \n\nIf you can figure the lock, we'll find something inside, probably something worth some coin.
Just because we have all eternity here, it doesn't mean we need to be dawdling about, you know.
So, did you find anything inside? \n\nI always fancied a crown for myself, one of those big jewel-studded affairs.
"Just a page from the Crone's journal."
Nothing but a mouldy piece of paper? Is that all ? This swamp really is cursed. \n\nI suppose that's the kinda clue you were looking for though, isn't it? Does it tell you where to search next?
"It's a clue, but no clear direction."

Well, Twillen isn't so much a town as a pile of wooden planks over the muck, but there's a tavern there, at least. \n\nI'd ask around. Someone in Twillen knows what became of the Crone. I'd bet my boots on it.
Well, this venture wasn't as profitable as I hoped, and the smell… I'm about done with this swamp. \n\nGood luck finding the old crone, and when you do, be careful.

I've translated the glyphs on the bridge, and it's clear this passage was once a major supply route. Just as with the obelisk, the bridge was protected by magical devices strategically placed to ward away some danger, almost certainly the Corruption. 

If I could find one of these devices, I had hoped to deconstruct it and determine what energy powered the Ancients' wards.

However, I've searched the length of the bridge, and whatever devices the Ancients' placed have long since been looted or destroyed. The only possibility is that one remains somewhere in the bridge's upper framework... if, if I can get up there.

At last! ! I've found one of the Ancient devices on top of the bridge, and there is even a flicker of power lurking inside it. This is the key to the answers I've been seeking. The list of experiments I can conduct with this is nearly endless. \n\nHopefully, this will renew Ser Brytmar's resolve. She recently declared her intent to abandon this endeavor, but even she should realize the potential of this... apparatus. If not, I will have to convince her, because I will most certainly need help getting it down from here and hauling it to Karburg.

The fact this rank stack of hovels stands as the last safe place in the Fen is testament to the Crone's evil legacy. \n\nLike Pennyfather, many here refuse to speak her name aloud… nor do they have word of Ser Brytmar.
"Brytmar doubted the Crone's plans."

Did she? Now that is encouraging… though it also disproves the theory my friend was ensorcelled. \n\nIf Brytmar abandoned the Crone, she may have returned to Hinbrucken in the southern marshes. I shall check there next.
A Weaver's Yarn
Ask the citizens of Twillen about the Corpse Crone to pick up her trail.
Go to Twillen to ask citizens about the Corpse Crone
Ask Fritz Cromer about the Corpse Crone
Ask Ruxandra cel Rau about the Corpse Crone
Ask Bella Ruby about the Corpse Crone

If Ser Brytmar were with us, we would have not only the benefit of her knowledge, but of her patience and strategic thinking as well. \n\nWithout her, we have only the terrified and distrustful people of Twillen.
"I should ask around town as well."

You should. Unfortunately, many people lost faith in the knights during the Wars of Crimson Madness. \n\nYour inquiries about the Corpse Crone may get more honest answers. Meantime, I'm off to Hinbrucken.
Good luck getting straight answers from these people. You'll need it.
What drags you into the vile waters of Weaver's Fen, traveler? \n\nBilge and bastards, that's all you'll find here… anyone who could leave this place has left long since.
"After the curse of the Corpse Crone?"

How dare you speak the name of that hideous fiend! She twisted the land and turned the living into Lost. \n\nWe are still burdened by the tyranny of her evil magic, and the best we can do is try to forget it.
"What about the Crone herself?"
She's still out there, lurking in the bog, taking anyone she finds back to her foul lair and stealing their souls! \n\nDon't be a fool - many have sought vengeance against her… none have returned.
I have nothing more to say to you, traveler. Leave here while you can.

Dismal as it is here, the weavers of the Fen still honor the old ways - we welcome you as an honored guest. \n\nOur numbers are few now, but if there is anything that will enhance your visit, just let it be known.
"I'm looking for the Corpse Crone."

Only the most foolish or desperate would seek out the old sorceress of the swamp. I wonder... which are you? \n\nHmm, if anyone around here knows how to find the Crone, it would be Bella Ruby, but I didn't tell you that.
If you have questions about the history of weaving in the fen, I can answer them. \n\nThat is my expertise.

Well, hello there! What brings you around these parts? Most people have better places to be than Weaver's Fen. \n\nBut for some of us, it's a safe refuge, a place where we can be who we want and live how we want.

Well, hello there! What brings you around these parts? Most people have better places to be than Weaver's Fen. \n\nBut for some of us, it's a safe refuge, a place where we can be who we want and live how we want.
"I'm trying to find the Corpse Crone."
Oh? Not to harm her, I hope! You should know the Crone's quite capable of defending herself... \n\nShe's not a monster you know. For those in need, the Crone has been known to help.
"Are you sure? I've read part of her journal."
Despite what others may say, the Corpse Crone doesn't want to turn everyone Lost. \n\nShe doesn't snatch people up in the night, or do anything they don't ask for.
Follow the Marsh Lights
Follow the Marsh Lights to find the Corpse Crone's location.
Follow the light of the torches
Get closer to the Corpse Crone
Tell Morgaine about your vision
Defeat Ser Brytmar to reach the cave

I sought the Crone myself at one point. You see, I was struggling with my identity... Who I am inside, and she helped me. \n\nShe gave me these wonderful medicines, and now everyone sees me in the way I see myself.
"So she's not just evil?"

No, but people need someone to blame for their misery, and they'll choose the easiest target. \n\nTo petition the Crone, follow the trail of torches on the south road… and be respectful! She has no patience for fools.
Take care on the southern road. \n\nThe Crone may have a kind soul buried under her gruff exterior, but the Lost do not.
Whatever your purpose in seeking the Corpse Crone, I hope she aids you as she did me.
Hm. You followed the lights, so you must want something. \n\nJudging by your appearance, however, I'm guessing it's not a friendly visit over a cup of tea.
"You're the Corpse Crone?"

Yes, one of many names I've been called. The Witch of Weaver's Fen, Swamp Sorceress, Corpse Crone... the list goes on. \n\nIronically, no one even knows me by my given name anymore… Brytmar was the last friend I had.
"What happened to Brytmar?"

It was tragic... and it was my fault. I thought I had finally found the perfect mixture. Brytmar insisted I test it on her rather than an unwilling subject… \n\nWe were the only two left from Camelot after the Wars… now I'm alone.
"Wait, do you know Galahad?"

Oh no, tell me you're not with that damned righteous fool! Agh! What the hell is he doing here? \n\nNo, no! Your petition is denied! You can pound your head against this barrier all you want - we are done here!

At first, I didn't recognize her, and even now I doubt my eyes. She is much changed, but there can be no doubt. \n\nThat's the enchantress Morgaine... sister to Myrddin, the Crimson Sorcerer... and traitor to my lord king!
"And you had no idea she was here?"

No, Morgaine vanished during the Wars of Crimson Madness, just like Myrrdin and the High King himself. \n\nThis Corpse Crone business is now a lesser concern - she has far more important questions to answer.
Temple of the Crone
Destroy the Arcane Anchors Morgaine uses to power the barrier at her cave.
Destroy the southern Arcane Anchor
Destroy the southwest Arcane Anchor
Destroy the western Arcane Anchor
Remove any Lost that would power up the devices

Dammit! Now it all makes sense! That's why Ser Brytmar remained loyal to the bitter end! \n\nBut I still don't understand… we all believed Morgaine succumbed to the Crimson Madness along with her brother…
"We need to talk to her."
Indeed. Nothing could be more important! She believes she's safe behind this barrier, but I know her secrets. \n\nMyrddin used wards like this on his sanctum, and there's a way to break through them.
"What do we need to do?"

There will be anchors scattered around the swamp - destroy those and we can confront her. \n\nI will remain here and ensure Morgaine doesn't escape and vanish again. This time, she will answer for what she's done.
Quickly now! We must destroy the anchors before she can strengthen the wards.
While you pursue people, I pursue power… and amass more of it by the minute...

Morgaine went to great lengths to protect her solitude… those anchors were farther than expected, but this barrier must come down. \n\nThough I goaded her into some dialogue, she's now back to ignoring me.
"You spoke with her?"

Yes, and though she was not very forthcoming, her account of what happened during the Wars of Crimson Madness does make some sense. \n\nI still have no answers to the fate of Artorius, but I have learned to live with that for now.
A Face in the Mist
Travel through the barrier at Morgaine's cave, tell her about your vision, and learn about Morgaine's past.
Weaken Morgaine's Barrier
Travel into Morgaine's cave
Tell Morgaine about your vision
Discover Morgaine's Past

Though she speaks coldly of Myrddin's fall, I detect some trace of sadness for the loss of her brother. \n\nBut Morgaine is not blameless in what occurred then, nor the dark acts she committed as the Corpse Crone.
"She confessed to all of it?

I would hardly call it a confession! She has an explanation for everything, of course, as she always did. \n\nMoreover, I question the veracity of some of her claims - you must interrogate her as well.
"How do I get in?"

With the anchors destroyed, the barrier should be weakened, and your staff can likely dispel it. \n\nGo on and hear Morgaine's explanations for yourself… I'll await you in Twillen. I've heard enough for today.
If even half of what she claims is true, then things are far different than I imagined.

I'm impressed - I felt quite assured no one had both the perception and the prowess to bring down my barrier. \n\nBut where is the most holy knight? Perhaps after cooling down, he remembered his steel is no match for my sorcery?
"He went back to Twillen."

That's for the best… we can have a more reasonable discussion. Galahad cannot accept that some questions have no answers. \n\nI watched Myrddin's fall to Corruption firsthand… I know the Crimson Menace does not play by the rules.
"Can you tell me what you know?"

I'm afraid that would take several lifetimes, and I'm quite busy at the present moment. \n\nIf you wish to hear my account of the Wars and the events that led to my unfortunate reputation… I've written it down just there. Go on.
Read the book. I have no time for questions from those who refuse to read.

So you see now that I have neither insight nor responsibility in whatever fate befell the High King. \n\nAs to my part in my brother's fall, I have spent every moment making amends… preparing for Corruption's eventual return.
"Corruption has returned already."

No! That, th-that… cannot be. I would know… I have been holed up in this cave for… well, for a long time. \n\nI will need to verify this for myself, of course, but if you speak the truth, then I have gravely miscalculated.
Setting Aside Differences
Convince Galahad that Morgaine's help is necessary before meeting Morgaine at Canopus.
Travel out of Morgaine's cave
Return to Twillen to explain the situation to Galahad
Convince Galahad Morgaine's help is necessary

Some people believe Corruption is mankind's inherent evil in its purest form, and others that it's some kind of demonic possession. \n\nIt's far more complex, however. I should know. I've spent centuries studying it.
"That's why the Soulwardens need your help."

Well, of course you do! It would be a shame if I spent all this time and could offer no value to them. \n\nWait… you're a Soulwarden? I thought the Order perished… nevermind, we'll need all the help we can get.
"Including Galahad."

Yes well, I'll leave that to you. I must visit the ruins to the northeast and verify the sources of power there have not fallen to Corruption. \n\nGo after Galahad if you must, but then meet me in the ruins of Canopus. I'll need your help.
I hope time has made Galahad more reasonable.

I'm still digesting the fact of Brytmar's fall and the claims of Morgaine, which have some merit, in truth. \n\nShe vexes me to no end, but I cannot dispute the insight she can lend to the cause of battling Corruption.
"Yes, we need her on our side."

Very well. Learn what you can from Morgaine, and perhaps convince her to join us at Caer Dun. \n\nI shall return to the fortress now to consult with Yonas on military strategy. That's where I belong. Light be with you, warden.
Let us hope Yonas has managed to recruit more Soulwardens. We'll need them.

Ah, perfect. Among these ruins, there are sources of power the Ancients learned to manipulate. \n\nOf most concern, the wells of pure azoth - Myrddin became obsessed with hoarding as much as he could.
"The Tempest… she seeks it as well.

The Tempest? Is that the champion Corruption has chosen in this era? We shall have to learn everything we can about her. \n\nWait… you have that look. Does the Tempest speak in your mind? Myrddin had such power, as well.
The Use of Azoth Energies
Collect Ancient Shield Devices for Morgaine and meet her at the Ancient Device in Andrometus.
Collect Ancient Shield Devices at {POITags}
Collect the first Shield Device
Collect the second Shield Device
Collect the third Shield Device
Power the Ancient Shield Devices by defeating {targetName}
How could so much have transpired while I toiled in that cave? I feel a fool for sequestering myself so long! \n\nIf this… Tempest is already amassing pure azoth, then we are so far behind.
"Where do we start?"

Yes. The fountain of pure azoth at this ruin dried long ago, but its residual power remains in the waters and in the Guardians who protect the site. \n\nWe must harness that power to recharge an Ancient warding apparatus nearby.
"How do we do that?"

Years ago, I placed shield devices to absorb the power here. If they aren't fully charged, you can siphon energy from the Guardians. \n\nI must go on to Andrometus, so once you have the devices, meet me there.
There should be several shield devices around Canopus. \n\nIf they aren't charged, you can siphon energy from the Ancient Guardians.

You handled that quickly and without complaint. It's been a long time since I partnered with someone so… competent. \n\nPeople disappoint - it's an unfortunate fact of nature. Only time will prove if you're an exception.
Unexpected Prisoner
Explore Andrometus to discover what has been imprisoned there.
Travel to the Ancient Console at {POITags}
Investigate the Ancient Chest
Examine the Ancient Console
Defeat {targetName} to recover a Blight Sample
(Optional: Use Blight Potions)
Recover a blight sample to bring back to Morgaine

This apparatus once powered Ancient wards for all these ruins, and recharging it will defend against the Corrupted. \n\nThere's some kind of fault in the eldritch boundaries, however… it may be impossible to repair.
"I can check out the fault."
A glutton for danger, are you? I hope you have some measure of restraint… but at the moment, I'll take the bravado. \n\nThe fault could be caused by a threat the wards identified and contained.
"What kind of threat?"

Well, if I knew that, I'd have said so. If that does prove to be the case - if some entity has been entrapped, it will need to be released. \n\nSo that courage could very well come in handy! Good luck!
Whatever's causing the fault in the eldritch boundaries, it must be remedied.
Hm. Twice now, you solved problems without coming back to whine about some complication. \n\nWas there some entity that had been entrapped in the wards?
"Yes, an Angry Earth creature."

That's strange. I can't imagine why an elemental being would trigger Ancient wards… is that a specimen you collected? \n\nLet's see… hm, the creature appears to have become blighted with some strange infection.
The Source of the Blight
Follow the trail of Blight back to its Source for Morgaine.
Follow the trail of Blight
Continue to follow the trail of Blight
Find the Source of the Blight
Ask Adiana about the Blight
Look at the Fountain
Return to Morgaine with your knowledge

I hope you took precautions gathering this sample… whatever blighted this creature, we need to find the source of it. \n\nAfter I recharge the wards, I will need to study this sample carefully and check the area for more.
"There's more. I can investigate it."

Yes, yes, yes. That adventurous spirit is definitely your weak spot, but once again, I'll take full advantage. \n\nI'll work on the wards while you track this... Blight back to its source. Do be careful.
Having second thoughts? If you want me to come with you, you'll have to wait some time.
Once again, we meet on sacred grounds rendered sickly by an insatiable thirst for power. \n\nYou should go. This time, there is no way to heal the land of the wounds inflicted by human ego.
"Humans caused the Blight?"
The repugnant incursion of Corruption caused this Blight, but that's what happens when humans traffick in forbidden power. \n\nOf course, your curiosity demands you see for yourself… go on then.
"What's in there?"
There's no menacing demon, if that's what you fear, rather just the tragic, polluted remnant of what once was a sacred pool. \n\nI have seen this too many times at this point. I will endure no more.
Satisfy your curiosity and leave, if you value your soul. This Blight is as detrimental to you as Corruption itself.
The forces of conscious nature are impotent to resist my influence… and with each ounce of pure azoth, my influence expands…
I can tell from here that the ruin and the Angry Earth who resided there are riddled with the Blight. \n\nLet me guess - the azoth fountain within had been claimed by the Corrupted, by the Tempest?
"How did you know?"

Recharging the wards proved impossible - so I knew the Corrupted must have already come and gone. \n\nI once theorized the Angry Earth could have a reaction to the Corrupted. Horrid as it appears, I find this Blight fascinating.
Corruption Spreads its Hooks
Travel back to Caer Dun to bring Yonus news from Morgaine.
Travel back to Caer Dun to bring news from Morgaine
(Optional: Use a Spirit Shrine to travel to Caer Dun)

I must return to my cave to examine this specimen of the Blight - it could lead to new defenses we could deploy against the Corrupted. \n\nAnd, then we'll need to secure whatever sources of pure azoth remain.
"We'll need a larger force."

Yes, of course, your fellow Soulwardens! It will be critical that we strike back against the Corrupted with both a martial and a magical strategy. \n\nTell me - where are you and your allies based? I will meet you there.
"Caer Dun in Brightwood."
I do not know this place, but after I study the Blight, I will find Caer Dun and bring my equipment with me. \n\nYou have impressed me at every turn, you know. This could be a promising partnership.
I hope we are not too late in our efforts to combat the Corrupted.
Every day we make a little more progress. I only hope it is enough.

Welcome home, young one. We have made strides while you were away. Many new souls joined our ranks. \n\nSer Galahad tells me the Corpse Crone was revealed to be none other than the sorceress Morgaine.
"She's going to join us."

That is good… I think. I'm afraid I have less inspiring tidings for you. \n\nWe've received a dispatch from a warlord among the Corrupted who knows you personally… Captain Thorpe, I believe is the name.
"Yes. I came here aboard his ship."

That explains it. He threatens you by name, accusing you of betrayal, thievery, cowardice… and the list goes on… he's furious about "his box." \n\nSome of the new wardens say they've seen him rallying the Corrupted forces in Great Cleave.
It seems this Thorpe has moved up the ranks of the Corrupted quickly to become a Commander. \n\nHe's claimed a stronghold and challenges you to come and face him there.
"Turn Off Ancient Device"
